programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.desc: Jamie shares a simple salmon dish perfect for a midweek meal, and some no-fuss fish cakes made from tins. He cooks a lamb Madras traybake, as well as a no-cook pasta sauce, and crowns it all off with a hot and crispy ice cream parcel!

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a speedy midweek chicken traybake. He shows us cool ways to upgrade salmon, knocks up a shelf-raid quesadilla toastie, and transforms a batch-cook Bolognese into cheesy bread bowls. All finished off with a super simple banoffee tart.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.sub-title: Smash Burger and Creamy Chicken with Mushrooms
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a midweek meal of speedy sweet pea chicken, a juicy Smash burger and a chicken and mushroom rice traybake. He batch-cooks his seven-veg sauce, followed by a spicy fish soup. And finishes off with a perfect pudding of tinned fruit granita.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.desc: Jamie shares a simple salmon dish perfect for a midweek meal, and some no-fuss fish cakes made from tins. He cooks a lamb Madras traybake, as well as a no-cook pasta sauce, and crowns it all off with a hot and crispy ice cream parcel!

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Is it a burger? Is it a sandwich? Is a burger a sandwich? Not even Frankie knows the answer, but one thing is certain: whatever you want to call them, these fun twists and familiar flavor combos are super satisfying to scarf down.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: As one of the cheapest members of the produce aisle, bananas will save you bunches of money when you whip up these delightfully appealing recipes that go above and beyond a basic bread.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver's 5 Ingredient Mediterranean Meals
programme.desc: Jamie hacks his oven into a rotisserie for crispy chicken and chips and bakes a savory spinach and feta pie. Then, the Godfather of Spanish cuisine, Jose Pizarro, shares some gorgeous Mediterranean flavours using just 5 everyday ingredients.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver's 5 Ingredient Mediterranean Meals
programme.sub-title: Pantry Pasta and Rice Pudding Pops
programme.desc: Jamie raids his pantry for a speedy veggie carbonara and rice pudding popsicles.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver's 5 Ingredient Mediterranean Meals
programme.desc: Jamie turns frozen fish and veggies into a time saving supper. Then, Italian chef, Gennaro Contaldo rustles up some delicious homemade gnocchi using just 5 easy ingredients.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver's 5 Ingredient Mediterranean Meals
programme.desc: Jamie's dressing a salad with a crown of cheese! He's also got a speedy twist on Sunday roast chicken and an elegant apple tart all with 5 fabulous ingredients.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Summer is coming to a close but there's still a bounty of fresh, seasonal produce to enjoy. Celebrate with Frankie as he makes some of his favorite cookout classics that'll take you from a weekend picnic to a backyard BBQ, with or without a grill.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Winter citrus is here to brighten up your day. Frankie is fixing up some light, zesty, and affordable recipes to add a little seasonal sunshine to your plate.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Cabbage has long been an underrated green on the field, and it's about time Frankie gives it a starring role. This leafy head proves itself as the versatile ingredient we need it to be, affordable year around, delicious and filling.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: When the temps are soaring and turning on your stove or oven is not even an option, Frankie's no cook meals will blow you away. Enjoy refreshing, nourishing dishes that will help keep you cool all summer long.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: These five-ingredient recipes are anything but boring; with a few pantry staples, these simple weeknight meals will be on the table in no time.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: You say hotdishes, Frankie says casserole. Either way, these one-pot hotdishes are an affordable way to feed a group of people, or the family for dinner. Plus they're great to freeze for future meals.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Join Frankie as he shares his budget friendly takes on Oktoberfest-inspired dishes, perfect for celebrating the fall season with friends. These festive and hearty meals will keep you cozy and full, and best of all, pair nicely with a beer.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie throws a game day party for under $25. Game days aren't for dinner parties but they are a day for some fan-favorite finger foods, especially those you can make in advance. Frankie makes three no-fuss appetizers.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Join Frankie to learn the ins and outs of using every part of a chicken, as he demonstrates how to maximize the value and minimize waste. By cooking smarter, you'll have three delectable recipes to last you the whole week.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie is all about BYOL - bring your own lunch. It's not only good for your wallet, it's good for your health. Skip the vending machine and the cafeteria in favor of creative, cost effective and easy-to-transport midday meals.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Cooking for Less
programme.sub-title: Stove Top Pizza with Caramelized Onions and Peppers
programme.desc: Jamie makes super-simple stuffed chicken thighs and a pizza that doesn't need the oven on. He turns the humble pancake into a showstopping stack of spinach, ham and cheesey gorgeousness.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Cooking for Less
programme.desc: Jamie celebrates the one dish wonder of a casserole with a Cajun chicken tray bake and a vegetable lasagna.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Cooking for Less
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver makes a giant Yorkshire pudding with stuffing and roast veg, cheesy gnocchi with bacon, spicy kipper kedgeree, and easy ice cream, all for under a buck a plate.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Cooking for Less
programme.sub-title: Barbecue Chicken, Roast Potatoes and Corn
programme.desc: Jamie takes root veg to another level, makes scrumptious sticky BBQ chicken and turns things upside down with a pineapple cake.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Stuffed Salmon Celebration and Almond Custard Tart
programme.desc: Jamie snazzes up some spuds with wild garlic pesto, creates a broad bean mezze, rustles up a beautiful spring salad and honours rhubarb in a luscious custard tart with almond brittle.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Spring Onion Chicken Curry and Sausage Broccoli Pizza
programme.desc: Jamie elevates asparagus spears for a fishy feat, makes spring onions the star of the show in his spicy green chicken curry and gives purple sprouting broccoli an Italian-inspired makeover.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Endless Summer: From Grilled Panzanella Salad to Sour Cherry Tart
programme.desc: Jamie ends summer with crispy duck in a rich plum sauce & roast potatoes. Grilled peppers star in panzanella. Garden zucchini become Mediterranean rice. Sweet finale: sour cherry frangipane with crème fraîche.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Buddy's Strawberry Rice Pudding and Summer Tomato Chicken Bake
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a chicken sheet pan dinner with early tomatoes, potatoes and chorizo. Buddy helps pick strawberries for quick jam rice pudding. The summer feast ends with spicy shrimp skewers with homegrown chillies and a refreshing cucumber gazpacho.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Crispy Pork Noodles and Cheesy Chard Cannelloni
programme.desc: Jamie celebrates rhubarb in a lip-smacking sauce, heroes spinach in a silky goat's cheese risotto and marries vibrant basil with chard in a crowd-pleasing cheesy spring cannelloni.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Summer-y Sweet Pea Risotto and Slow Roasted Pork
programme.desc: Jamie celebrates summer with roasted fennel pork & gratin, oozy pea risotto, and rainbow slaw chicken wraps. He shares edible hanging basket tips. The feast finishes with stunning mackerel on sun-dried tomato couscous with colorful beets.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Buddy's Strawberry Rice Pudding and Summer Tomato Chicken Bake
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a chicken sheet pan dinner with early tomatoes, potatoes and chorizo. Buddy helps pick strawberries for quick jam rice pudding. The summer feast ends with spicy shrimp skewers with homegrown chillies and a refreshing cucumber gazpacho.
